Package main.java.view

Interface IFrameView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CreateFlexiblePortfolioView, FlexibleStockDetails, GraphDisplayView, LoadPortfolio, MainMenuView, PortfolioCompositionSelection, PortfolioDisplayComposition, RebalanceView, StockPercentView, StrategyDistribution, StrategyOnDate, UpdateCommissionView
    public interface IFrameView
    This interface represents the view part of the MVC architecture for portfolio management application. View is responsible for showing the output to the User. View formats the data received from the controller into a human-readable format. This interface focuses on the graphical interface for the user

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addActionListener​(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
      This method allows the controller listeners to the view buttons and fields.
      void addDocumentListener​(javax.swing.event.DocumentListener listener)
      This method allows the controller to listen to input fields, validate them and provide appropriate responses to the user depending upon the field change.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getFields()
      This method is used to get the values of fields in the view, which controller can use to determine the course of actions.
      javax.swing.JFrame getFrame()
      This method gives the current frame of the view which is being displayed to the user.
      void setErrorLabels​(java.lang.String component, java.lang.String error)
      This method allows us to the set Error message on a specific component in order to user to realize that the input given by the user is invalid.
      void setSubmit​(boolean enable)
      This method allows us to manipulate the enabling of the submit button, to make sure the state of view is maintained.
      default void showDialogBox​(java.lang.String caption, java.lang.String title, boolean isError)
      This method allows us to generate the dialog box and decide if its an error or an informational message.

    • Method Detail

      • getFrame

        javax.swing.JFrame getFrame()
        This method gives the current frame of the view which is being displayed to the user.
        Returns:
        The present frame of the view

      • addActionListener

        void addActionListener​(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
        This method allows the controller listeners to the view buttons and fields. The change in the elements in which the listener is attached the controller can make a decision on what to show to the user.
        Parameters:
        listener - The action listener from controller that needs to be attached

      • addDocumentListener

        void addDocumentListener​(javax.swing.event.DocumentListener listener)
        This method allows the controller to listen to input fields, validate them and provide appropriate responses to the user depending upon the field change.
        Parameters:
        listener - The document listener from controller that needs to be attached

      • getFields

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getFields()
        This method is used to get the values of fields in the view, which controller can use to determine the course of actions.
        Returns:
        It returns the values of the fields in the view.

      • setSubmit

        void setSubmit​(boolean enable)
        This method allows us to manipulate the enabling of the submit button, to make sure the state of view is maintained.
        Parameters:
        enable - Boolean to enable button or not.

      • showDialogBox

        default void showDialogBox​(java.lang.String caption,
                           java.lang.String title,
                           boolean isError)
        This method allows us to generate the dialog box and decide if its an error or an informational message.
        Parameters:
        caption - The message that user needs to be known
        title - The Title of the Dialog box
        isError - Is it an error box

      • setErrorLabels

        void setErrorLabels​(java.lang.String component,
                    java.lang.String error)
        This method allows us to the set Error message on a specific component in order to user to realize that the input given by the user is invalid.
        Parameters:
        component - The component that needs to show the error
        error - The error string.
